name: sloppily
content:
sloppily adverb
(BADLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
disapproving badly or carelessly: a sloppily written letter I think this test was done sloppily.
More examplesFewer examplesThere's a difference between working quickly and working sloppily.I am sorry to say some of the documents were sloppily written.This article has some good insights, but it's also sloppily constructed.

sloppily adverb
(UNTIDILY)
in an untidy way, in clothes that are large and loose: The owner of the cafe described the men he saw as sloppily dressed and speaking English. We were getting people coming to work dressed sloppily.
More examplesFewer examplesWhat you wear is unlikely to make you stand out, unless you dress sloppily.He's not slick, and he's sloppily dressed. A survey shows TV viewers are fed up with sloppily dressed presenters.

sloppily adverb
(WET)
informal disapproving in a way that has a lot of liquid, often unpleasantly so: Brushes and rags were sloshing sloppily in the mess from the bucket. He bounded to the door and kissed Genevieve sloppily on the forehead.
More examplesFewer examplesThere was so much chicken and it was sloppily tasty.I realized I was eating very sloppily again. His white room had been attacked with a paintbrush, black colour sloppily smeared over the walls.He introduced them to Dr. Milstein, who sloppily kissed Sara's hand.

sloppily adverb
(SILLY)
informal disapproving (of feelings) expressed in a way that is silly or embarrassing: She spoke in a way that was sloppily sentimental.
More examplesFewer examplesIt takes courage to be that sloppily sentimental.The whole thing was so sloppily emotional it was revolting.
